channel.title: Circumflex on KrolTech

item.title: Up / Down HTML arrow characters (for sorting, etc)
item.author: jkat98@gmail.com (Jason Krol)
item.description: I was searching for the opposite of the caret, or circumflex, character (^) and couldn’t really find one. Typically, in a pinch when I’m mocking, I would just use the caret ^ and a lowercase v – but they don’t look the same. There doesn’t seem to be a good opposite for the caret character – but I found 2 extremely useful HTML character codes to use instead: ∧ (∧) and ∨ (∨)
